title: Lazy Loading Modules
subject: Angular
theory: By default, NgModules are eagerly loaded. Lazy loading means a module is loaded only when the user navigates to its route. This significantly reduces the initial bundle size and load time.

examples.explanation: Webpack splits this module into a separate chunk (e.g., chunk.js) loaded on demand.

common_mistakes.correction: Do NOT import a lazy loaded module in the root AppModule. That defeats the purpose.

interview_questions.question: Why use lazy loading?
interview_questions.answer: To decrease initial load time by splitting code into smaller bundles loaded only when needed.

summary: Lazy loading is a critical performance optimization for large Angular applications.
